channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Trump Florida shooting: Alleged gunman Ryan Routh wrote of 'assassination attempt', offered $150,000 bounty to ‘finish the job’
item.description: Ryan Routh, aged 58, allegedly attempted to assassinate former President Donald Trump at his Florida golf course by aiming a rifle through the tree line. He had earlier written a letter offering $150,000 for Trump's assassination. Routh faces federal gun charges and additional charges may be pending as the investigation continues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Oil, prostitutes, candles: What ex-girlfriend Cassie said about Sean 'Diddy' Combs
item.description: The allegations made by singer Cassie Ventura, a former girlfriend of Combs, have brought significant attention to the case. Ventura filed a civil lawsuit against Combs, alleging years of abuse and forced participation in these "freak-offs." In her lawsuit, Cassie claimed that Combs directed her to pour "excessive" amounts of oil on herself, instructed her where to touch prostitutes, and filmed the encounters while masturbating. She described these acts as "personal art projects" for Combs, noting how he would adjust candles to achieve the perfect lighting for his videos.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: RFK Jr may sue Olivia Nuzzi for 'bombarding' him with nudes: 'No romance, he was chased by porn'
item.description: Jessica Read Kraus, who knows both Nuzzi and Kennedy Jr, said Nuzzi tricked Kennedy Jr into receiving her "racy messages" after he first blocked her number over a flirtatious remark she made just two weeks after she wrote the profile on RFK Jr. “Once unblocked, she bombarded him with increasingly pornographic photos and videos that he found difficult to resist. After brief exchanges, he would block her again,” Kraus alleged.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Janet Jackson says Kamala Harris is not black, apologizes (or not), fires spokesperson
item.description: Jackson said Elmasri does not represent her and the apology statement has no connection with Elmasri. Elmasri told the Daily Beast that he was fired due to disagreements over this particular issue. He said he was flooded with phone calls after Jackson denied the apology statement but he maintained "all support to Kamala Harris".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Kamala Harris denied Kimberly Guilfoyle a job: 'She called and pretended to be...'
item.description: Donald Trump Jr's fiancee Kimberly Guilfoyle alleged that Kamala Harris attempted to block her from a job over two decades ago when both were young lawyers. Despite Harris' alleged interference, Guilfoyle was hired though Kamala Harris left the job soon after. Those who know both of them confirm that Kamala Harris and Guilfoyle never got along, though Harris never admitted she tried to block the job.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: South Africa's N3 highway reopens after severe snowstorm disruptions
item.description: South Africa's N3 highway at Van Reenen's Pass has reopened following a severe snowstorm that disrupted traffic between Gauteng and KwaZulu-Natal. Authorities advise daytime travel due to lingering slippery conditions. The storm left many stranded for hours, prompting emergency services and humanitarian aid. The government urges citizens to stay informed through local radio stations and social media updates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Failed test of Russian RS-28 Sarmat missile captured in satellite imagery
item.description: Satellite images from Maxar dated September 21 show signs of a potential failure during a test of Russia's RS-28 Sarmat missile at Plesetsk Cosmodrome. A large crater and surrounding damage were observed, indicating a serious incident. The Russian defence ministry has not issued any statements or announced recent tests involving the missile.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Maldives president seeks an end to Gaza war, more dynamic multilateral system
item.description: At the UN Summit of the Future, Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu called for ending the Gaza war and granting Palestine full UN membership. He urged making multilateralism effective by empowering youth, combating climate change, and ensuring sustainable financing. Muizzu highlighted that future generations will judge based on concrete actions taken.

item.title: Who is Hassan Nasrallah, the Hezbollah leader who vowed retaliation against Israel
item.description: Hassan Nasrallah, Hezbollah's leader since 1992, recently addressed an attack on the group's communication devices. Supported by Iran and opposed by Israel, he has transformed Hezbollah into Lebanon's most influential political force. Despite controversies like backing Syria's Assad during the Arab Spring, Nasrallah remains a significant figure in Lebanese politics.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris vs Donald Trump: Closest presidential race of century in US's history
item.description: The US presidential race between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris is highly competitive, with recent surveys showing Harris leading by just 3 points. This narrow margin highlights the intense nature of the election. Polls from CBS News and NBC News also indicate that Harris holds a slight lead over Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JetBlue flight makes emergency landing from 36k feet in minutes in US
item.description: A JetBlue flight from New York to San Diego made an emergency landing at Salina Regional Airport after pilots received alerts of possible smoke or fire in the cargo bay. The plane descended quickly and landed safely. No fire was detected, and passengers were transported by local school buses to the terminal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: From Bibles to Sneakers: The unusual Trump merch you can buy now
item.description: Donald Trump has diversified from real estate to sell various items including Bibles, sneakers, suit fragments, and coins with his image. Despite previous business failures like Trump University and Trump steaks, he continues marketing these products. These sales do not fund his campaign but use his likeness under a paid license.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Yahya Sinwar alive? Unsure Israel probes Hamas leader's death
item.description: The Israeli military is investigating if Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, associated with the October 7 attacks, is dead. Media reports suggest his possible death or injury in recent bombings, but Israeli intelligence lacks confirmation. Sinwar's past silence has led to false death claims before. This investigation coincides with Hamas rejecting a US-proposed hostage deal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Regional victory brings Germany's Scholz brief respite from growing pressure within party
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's Social Democrats narrowly defeated the far-right Alternative for Germany in Brandenburg's regional election. Despite this win, Scholz faces growing criticism within his party and declining national support. Tensions are rising within the coalition government due to poor performances by junior partners, adding to political instability.

item.title: Mayor of Muslim-majority Michigan city endorses Trump over Harris
item.description: Amer Ghalib, mayor of Hamtramck, a Detroit-area suburb with a Muslim majority, has endorsed Donald Trump for the 2024 presidential election. In a Facebook post written in Arabic, Ghalib expressed his belief that Trump is the right choice for this critical time. Polls indicate a challenging race ahead as Vice President Kamala Harris gains ground.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk plans five uncrewed Starship missions to Mars in two years
item.description: Elon Musk revealed that SpaceX is preparing to launch five uncrewed Starship missions to Mars in the next two years, aligning with the upcoming Earth-Mars transfer window. The success of these missions will determine when crewed flights can begin, potentially within four years if all goes well.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Coldplay India concert 2025: BookMyShow crashes minutes before tickets go live; IRCTC and other memes flood internet
item.description: Thousands of fans faced frustration as BookMyShow crashed just before Coldplay concert tickets went on sale. The British band will perform in Mumbai's DY Patil Stadium in January 2025, marking their return to India after eight years. An additional show has been added due to high demand despite the technical issues.
item.dc:creator: TOI Tech Desk

item.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz to raise Kashmir, Palestine, Islamophobia issues at UNGA
item.description: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif is set to address the United Nations General Assembly on September 27. He will discuss issues including Jammu and Kashmir, Palestine, and rising Islamophobia. Last year, Pakistan highlighted Kashmir as essential for peace with India. India responded by calling for an end to cross-border terrorism and addressing human rights violations in Pakistan.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: 'There’s more to talk about': Kamala Harris has a message for Donald Trump; watch video
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris urged former President Donald Trump to engage in another debate on CNN next month. Despite Trump's refusal, citing ongoing voting, Harris emphasized the necessity of discussing issues and policies for American voters. With over a month remaining, she highlighted the race's closeness and her readiness for further debate.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Will Trump make another run for President if he loses in 2024? Here's what he said
item.description: Donald Trump, 78, has declared he will not seek another presidential bid if he loses the November 5 election against Kamala Harris. The competition is tight, with Harris making gains in national polls. Trump continues to allege voter fraud in his 2020 loss and faces criminal charges over efforts to overturn those results.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
